summary: This is an email chain from December 12, 2019, where James Beal, US Editor for The Sun, forwards a query to the FBI's New York office. Beal is inquiring about a claim made on Twitter by a victim of Jeffrey Epstein that the FBI is investigating a credible death threat against her, and he requests a comment from the FBI.

persons.name: James Beal
persons.context: Journalist who emails the FBI's New York office to inquire about a victim's claim of a death threat investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose victim is claiming a death threat.

connections.description: Beal is a journalist inquiring about a threat against a victim of Epstein.

events.title: Journalist inquiry about death threat claim
events.description: James Beal emails the FBI's New York office regarding a Twitter claim by a Jeffrey Epstein victim that the FBI is investigating a credible death threat against her.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein claimed on Twitter that the FBI was investigating a credible death threat against her.
Journalist James Beal of The Sun contacted the FBI's New York office on December 12, 2019, seeking comment on this claim.
The email indicates ongoing public and media scrutiny regarding threats against individuals associated with the Epstein case.
